body_content.explanation: in books and films, a situation in which a period of time is repeated, sometimes several times, so that the characters have to live through a series of events again:
examples: In the movie Groundhog Day, Bill Murray finds himself trapped in a time loop in a small town, condemned to repeat the same day's pattern of events over and over.
The novel’s temporal loops and flashbacks can easily make you disorientated.
